_header: Then the knight and the steward free

NLS1931.First Lines:
…þoffe y owe syche toodowne sate sir amadas &
                    heeAnd kast how þat best myȝt beeboþe far and
                    nere…
NLS1931.Last Lines:
…yette schall þei cum sum tyme þer tyllAnd passe
                    full wele a wey

Hardman,  Phillipa.

         Leeds Texts and Monographs, n.s. 16. Leeds: School of English,
            2000.

Smith,  M. N.,
                        ed.  
             “An Edition of the Ireland and Edinburgh Texts of Sir Amadace.” 
         Leeds University Library, unpublished.

PULTayM9.First Lines:
…Henne the knyȝt and þe stuard freÞay casten
                    þere hone hit best myȝte bebothe be ferre and
                    Nere…
PULTayM9.Last Lines:
…Blesse and glade þis cumpanyAnd ore vs halde his
                    hande
PULTayM9.Note:
Imperfect at beginning due to loss of folio 16, with first 48
                    lines.
